citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male rabbit named "Smokey" became listless on Sunday, July 30, 2023 and the facility was not able to contact their
attending veterinarian or find emergency care. The facility tried to contact veterinary clinics to no avail, but did not call the
two emergency clinics listed on their Program of Veterinary Care. Therefore, veterinary care or consultation was not
received and “Smokey” was found deceased the next morning. The failure to provide prompt care to this rabbit and to
follow the pre-approved emergency plan, might have caused undue pain, distress or even resulted in the death of this
animal. The licensee, must use appropriate methods to treat diseases and injuries and must therefore, in conjunction with
the attending veterinarian, develop, as well as a follow, an appropriate plan for emergency care.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by DECEMBER 11, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
